DOC.brief_summary: The aim study use ACTH predictive marker patient threaten preterm labor .
DOC.brief_title: Maternal Serum Level ACTH Predictive Marker Preterm Labor Patients With Threatened Preterm Labor
DOC.detailed_description: This cross sectional study include 261 pregnant woman age 17 35 year singleton pregnancy 28 36 complete week gestation diagnose threatened preterm labor consent participate study . This study conduct Ain Shams University Maternity Hospital approval research ethic committee . investigator include patient follow criterion ( Singleton pregnancy , Age 17 - 35 year , Gestational age 28 36 week Diagnosis threaten preterm labor base American College Obstetricians Gynaecologists Guidelines ( ACOG , 2003 ) : Presence uterine contraction ( least 4 20 minute 8 60 minute ) , Cervical dilation > 1 < 4 cm , and/or Cervical effacement ≥ 80 % . investigator exclude patient follow criterion ( Preterm rupture membrane , Any uterine anomaly cervical incompetence , Chronic illness chronic hypertension kidney disease , Diabetes mellitus , Abruptio placenta , Preeclampsia HELLP syndrome , Fetal anomaly , IUGR , Smoking Clinical sign intrauterine infection ) . blood sample collect patient measurement ACTH level . According local protocol Ain Shams University Maternity Hospital woman receive fix regimen tocolysis form nifedipine ( Epilat ) 10 mg orally every 15 minute first hour cessation uterine contraction . Then , 60 - 160 mg/day ( 1-2 tablet 3 time daily ) slowly release nifedipine ( epilat retard 20 mg tablet ) may give depend uterine activity . The patient also receive 6 mg dexamethasone every 12 hour 4 dos . All woman follow till delivery . After delivery , investigator divide patient 2 group ( full term delivery & preterm delivery ) compare 2 group level hormone .
DOC.criteria: Singleton pregnancy . Age 17 35 year . Gestational age 28 36 week . Diagnosis threaten preterm labor base American College Obstetricians Gynaecologists Guidelines ( ACOG , 2003 ) : Presence uterine contraction ( least 4 20 minute 8 60 minute ) , Cervical dilation > 1 < 4 cm , and/or Cervical effacement ≥ 80 % . Preterm rupture membrane . Any uterine anomaly cervical incompetence . Chronic illness chronic hypertension kidney disease . Diabetes mellitus . Abruptio placenta . Preeclampsia HELLP syndrome . Fetal anomaly . IUGR . Smoking . Clinical sign intrauterine infection eg ( uterine tenderness , foul vaginal discharge , maternal pyrexia ≥ 38°C and/or maternal leucocytosis ) .
